name: Concat Columns
description: Concatenates the values of the given columns

nodes.name: ConcatColumns
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by concatenating the specified columns of the input DataFrame
nodes.details:
It creates a new DataFrame by concatenating specified columns of the input DataFrame into a new column.

A new column is added to the incoming DataFrame by concatenating the specified columns. The new DataFrame is sent to the output of this Node.
nodes.examples:
If incoming Dataframe has two columns [CUST_CD] and [CUST_NAME] which need to be concatenated to new column [CUST_IDENTIFIER] using separator [-] then output Dataframe would
be created as below:

  • CUST_CD : C001
  • CUST_NAME : DAVID
  • CUST_IDENTIFIER : C001-DAVID

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level

fields.name: outputCol
fields.title: Concatenated Column Name
fields.description: Column name for the concatenated columns

fields.name: sep
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: Separator to be used when concatenating the columns

nodes.name: DatasetStructured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
This node is used to print incoming dataset.

Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

fields.value:
DataPreparation Workflow using Concat column Node


  • It demonstrate how to concetante two or more selected fields from input dataframe creating a new concatenated column with the desired separator.
